channel.title: Suggestion for site
channel.description:
Idk if any one cares what i think, but has any one looked at the members list under post count? there are over a thousand pages of people registered, and only 185 pages of them have at least one post, the other 110000 or so people have no posts at all, i think there should be automatic trimming or some thing, if you don't make at least one post in the first week of being registered then your account is deleted maybe, that was ever one has plenty of time to make a post...
Ok... thats just my $.02 i have been meening to post here but i always forget lol, so does any one agree with me?

item.title: Suggestion for site
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“Fr33sc4p3, post:14, topic:105394”][quote author=Martin link=topic=150994.msg1443559#msg1443559 date=1181186147]

Them extra 100k members take upto next to no space, so why prune?
Its causing no inconvenience not costing any extra so what is the point?

Who would want 100k inactive members on their forum?
[/quote]

I wouldnt care.

Its like if you was driving down the road and a tree was in the road but plenty of room to drive around it and still stay on your half of the road, you would not move it out of the way you would carry on driving, so why go out of your way to do something that does not really affect anyone[/quote]
Hmm, I think it’s more of, as George Carlin would put it, prick waving. He is showing off the size of his prick and waving it in other forums’ face by having 100k members, whether they are active or not it is still a big number

Read full topic

yea, just like 10,000 users who have more then one post, there are like 2000 with only one post also though…

item.description:

item.title: Suggestion for site
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:6, topic:105394”][quote author=Kmb link=topic=150994.msg1427881#msg1427881 date=1180919025]
Let the wheels of capitalism roll. 100k+ members looks a lot more interesting than 10k in the eyes of an advertiser, doesn’t it?
[/quote]After seeing how many users out of that 100k+ actually posts I don’t think so. “In the eyes of an advertiser”, the advertiser would be Mopar? He also publishes ads on his site, but it’s not his choice who’s ads get shown on it. Nor is it the choice of the advertiser who’s site their ad gets shown on (At least for google, I think).[/quote]

I also think all the spam the 10,000 members make covers up for more than the 100,000+ anyway.

Read full topic

item.description:
@frank wrote:

i think kmb absurdly means, COME ON DOWN TO MOPAR, WE HAVE 100,000 MEMBERS YOH!

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestion for site
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

I agree, there’s no reason to have that many users with no posts that have been registered for so long (especially since the site started). The least they could do is post, at least it’s positively contributing to the community.

Read full topic
